description:
Update: cafe x has great customer support. I came to cafe x with a coworker during lunch where we got the matcha latte and dirty chai latte. both were GOOD. coffee fills to the top of the cup and is warm/hot! I will definitely be coming back :)

I didn't quite have a good first experience here - I decided to try this place out after work and ordered a dirty chai latte but one of the pumps didn't work for the robot :(. my cup was about 50-60% full. not sure if that was how it was suppose to come out. May give this place another try next week and will update my review
author: Wes L.

description:
Efficient & amusing experience. $3 cup of Matcha Latte, done in 3 minutes! Then Robot waves goodbye!

- First-time visit & there was no line. Ordered Matcha Latte + oak milk, the system gives you a 4 digit code sent to your phone. Then use that code to get your coffee. The entire process took less than 5 minutes. 

- Although the robot doesn't speak or have expressions, it does wave to you after the drink is taken. Def puts a smile on our face.

- The drink is tasty. Oak milk added a little sweetness & creamy layer to the matcha. Coffee options includes Ritual coffee & Equator, etc. local brands. 

- Found nothing to complain about... thus the 5 stars!
author: Jess W.

description:
Automation is supposed to make it cost less. But for $4.5, I got a small cup of coffee that tastes just so so. 

It might be a good story for VC investors. But what's in it for consumers?
author: H S.

description: Basically vending machine coffee that a robotic arm picks up and hands over to you via a dispensing tunnel.
author: Sai J.

description: Coffee served by a robot? Sure, why not?! I came across this cool thing today after watching a movie in Metreon and I thought it was awesome. I gave it a try and ordered a cup of A Really Good Matcha Latte with oatly milk. It was somewhat pricey for just a small cup but the latte was indeed really good and was actually one of the best matcha lattes I've ever had. Yes, better than Starbucks' in my opinion. I will most definitely try again!
author: Celina A.

description:
How cool is this little coffee-bot?  He... or uh... maybe she even gives you a cute little wave when you pick up your coffee.  Seriously didn't know if I was supposed to wave back or not.

Only one size here so don't expect to get a Venti but the prices are appropriate so the P2P ratio is good.  

Love the concept of being texted a code to pick up your drink when it's ready to ensure you get what you ordered.  

The convenience of it was great since I was there for Dreamforce creating crazy lines at Starbucks and Peet's.  

Is this just a novelty or do the Mega-java slingers need to be worried?  

Time will tell...
author: Robb M.

description:
No human interaction and perfect coffee. Seriously so neat! The prices were great and inexpensive. I had the green tea latte and it was pretty tasty! A little sweeter than I'd prefer. 

The wave at the end was adorable. It's located inside the Target.
author: Aleeson P.

description: My fiancé has been wanting to visit and have his coffee made by a robot. It was pretty cool watching the robot make our coffee and it was so cute how it waved bye at us once we received our drinks. I ordered the matcha green latte and my fiancé ordered the cafe mocha and it turned out to taste good. Check it out, it's pretty cool!
author: Neloffer E.

description:
This kiosk is located inside the Metreon by the elevators in the food court by Sharetea. No pastries (the Market location does). Unfortunately there is only one drink size.  There's also no way to adjust the sweetness. Non-dairy options available.

Order in the app/posted tablet & then a code will be texted to you.
Drink will be made by a Keuig-like machine.
Watch the robot arm get your drink.
Enter your code at the kiosk to get your drink.
Wave bye to the robot arm.

My order:
Oatly Matcha Latte

After wandering outside in the cold, we wanted a warm drink. One of our friends hardly comes into SF so we had to bring him here for the novelty. We had issues with our promo codes but Lee helped us out and even got us a free drink for our troubles. Nice way to warm up. 

They do have a referral program: Use my code 74FRTE and get $5 (must be used in app)!
author: Kitty K.

description:
Came here and got a free coupon code to try a free coffee! They have a few really interesting drinks and a bunch of different options for add-ons and sweetness levels etc. 

My personal favorite was the cafe mocha or matcha drink.

Swing by and give it a try and wave hello to the robot while you're here!
author: Andrew T.

description: Really cool cafe concept.  I love the efficiency and quality that comes with this place.  The whole process was very well designed, from ordering your drink to picking it up, it's all very smooth.  I like that there are 3 kiosks here to order from as well as 3 pickup locations so you don't end up stuck behind someone who can't make up their mind.  Overall, the price point was great, quality roasteries from around SF for a good price.  Plus, the entertainment of watching a robot make your drink was very cool as well.  Considering how little space these things occupy, I would love to see this concept more around SF or the Bay Area.  Getting your coffee quick is something I really want more of, especially if you're in a rush to be somewhere.
author: Bryson L.

description: LOL... ITS A ROBOT MAKING COFFEE...it makes cappuccino or latte drinks among others... select, pay, it gives you a code that will open the door to get your drink, and the robot arm waves to you...
author: Greg S.

description:
My friend and I were about to head home after spending a few hours at Uncorked wine festival upstairs at the city view. We came across Cafe X when we entered the building and it was next to the elevators so it's hard to miss. We decided to grab one drink and we got the matcha latte which was pretty good. It has the right amount of sweetness and the taste of matcha was pretty strong. 

The concept is fun since the whole cafe is operated by a robot and the whole process is pretty simple. You choose your drink from a few choices, pay with your card, receive a code, watch your drink get made and placed on the side until you enter the code. Oh and their choices of milk were organic milk or a nondiary alternative oatmilk for $1 more i believe.

The process was pretty quick too there is about four ordering stands so you dont have to wait behind one line if people are taking their time ordering. I think the robot can serve up to four customers at one time but I am not sure since there was only one other person ordering at the same time as us.
author: David Y.

description:
This is why the future is bleak as hell. I went to CafeX after they pushed out my local florist just to look the enemy in the face and drink it's coffee. It sucked, as expected.

Riddle me this, if it was more cost effective for a robot to serve coffee, why the hell does CafeX still employ a person to be there in case it breaks? 

It's like they've defeated the purpose of having a robot there, you might as well have the guy just make the coffee.

All in all I think CafeX totally embodies what's wrong with San Francisco and tech culture, and I work in the sector, so I'm intimately aware of how this company came to be.

Essentially it's a company pushing out local businesses, offering some cheesy niche product with hopes of eliminating jobs, cutting costs, and offering a service that brings human beings one step further away from having personal interactions.

So basically, screw CafeX.
author: John W.

description:
I was browsing Yelp's Hot and New filter and Cafe X caught my eye because the idea of getting a coffee from a robot sounded awesome. This cafe is located in the Metreon and your first drink is free if you download the app. You can customize the level of sweetness and flavor of your coffee using the app or the screens surrounding the robot. I ordered the Caffe Latte with standard sugar and standard caramel and it was perfect. 

Once your coffee is ready, you enter a code at any of the screens near the window and the robot brings your coffee to you. The robot is super efficient and my coffee was ready within minutes! Thank you for the latte robot. You're an excellent barista.
author: Karen L.

description:
I came to Cafe X once I heard about it all over the news and Snapchat (yup). I was super excited to check it out, as it's the first robot-driven-coffee-maker in SF (and the U.S.?).

Pros:
-Cheap prices. Most are $2-3 per coffee compared to $4-5 at your average coffee shop here.
-You get to watch the robot make your drink for you.
-You get a text on your phone for the 4-digit code to get your drink. And you get to watch your drink being put into the slot that you put your code into.
-There's a small 6-person table and Metreon has wi-fi so you can actually come here to do some work.
-I tried the Americano and it actually wasn't bad (though I'm not much of a coffee drinker).
-Download their app and get $10 free credit.
-They make the coffee pretty fast. You only have to wait ~2min.

Cons:
-You can't buy coffee if you don't have a credit card or phone. This isn't too friendly to people who don't carry phones or cash. And even if you do have a phone, they text you your code, so it might be an additional cost for those who don't have free text messaging.
-They don't have cup holders so when you grab your drink through the slot, it's super hot. (I'm use to having the baristas put the cup holder on for you, so it's not so hot when you grab your drink).
-Only 7 types of drinks and 3 types of beans to choose from (Verve, AKA, Peet's).
-Only size is a small cup. 
-Their app needs improvement. When I entered my number, it texted me a code to enter in the app. When I opened the text to get the code and went back to the app, the app refreshed and I wasn't able to enter my code. Had to do this multiple times until I was able to sign up. :(
-Although there's a small table, it's a bit uncomfortable/odd to do work here. I did get some work done, but I honestly like being in Philz's cozy environment. Oh well, at least I gave it a shot.


The technology and innovation about Cafe X is impressive, but it's like a claw machine at a carnival. You see it and all the cool stuff about it excites you, so you drop a bill to watch that claw grab your prize and drop it off to you. And you feel pretty satisfied, but then excitement fades and you don't feel anything about it. No emotional attachment. Nothing. So you continue on with your life and the next time you want coffee, you head to your usual spot before you knew of Cafe X.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Getting coffee has never been simpler. 

You just select your beverage of choice, your coffee beans, pay at the iPad kiosk, and watch the robot arm make your coffee.

There's nothing much to the coffee, as the options are all pretty standard (cappucino, latte, etc). They use coffee beans from Peets, Verve, and AKA, any of which you can select from for your beverage of choice. My latte was pretty standard, definitely nothing to write home about. 

If you value price point (under $4), convenience, and as little human interaction as possible, this is perfect for your basic coffee needs. 

If you like your drinks a little more complex or value the interaction with your barista, don't come to the kiosk. You will not like it.
author: Viet N.

description:
Loved this robot! Made my drink super fast and efficient. Such a fun and unique experience to enjoying a cup of joe; however, I ordered a hot chocolate with oatly milk! It was super chocolatey and creamy - my mouth is watering just thinking about it! Also had the opportunity to sip from my boyfriend's oatly latte, which I also recommend. Will definitely come back when in the area.. thinking of trying the matcha latte next time! 

Note that there is only one size option (not sure if this has changed since my recent visit a few weeks ago). I did appreciate that there are options to customize drinks too! Oh the wonderful and amazing things a robot can do!
author: Sofia B.

description:
Cool concept and very fitting for the tech hub that is SF. Cafe X is located inside the Metreon, near the escalators heading up to AMC. The process is simple: you put in your order and pay at the iPad kiosk, then once your drink is ready, you'll get a text along with a code to use to pick up your drink. Just getting an espresso or simple coffee drinks here are a bit cheaper than at some artisan places (probably because they save on the cost of hiring a barista), and service is quite fast. IMO, the robotic arm is also kind cute when it sets down the cup :) 

However, there aren't that many options for coffee drinks and the variety of customizations are a bit limited (e.g. there are no non-diary options yet). They also have staff on hand in case anything does goes wrong - in fact the robot did get stuck trying to dump out a drink it didn't have (the cup it was supposed to pick up got stuck) - so a technician had to step in and get it working again.

Very cool to see it for the first time, but probably won't go out of my way to get coffee from here. If the robot could make cool latte art and/or more sophisticated drinks, now that might be something to swing by for :)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Cafe X is the future.

The service is quick (obviously), the prices are right, and the quality of the drinks are good. Doesn't hurt that the super-friendly staff sits nearby, ready to answer any questions or solve any issues.

Served by a robot arm in a huge, modern glass chamber, customers are asked to order on the iPad stand, or via an app to download. This is where the novelty just starts, though, as you're able to observe the arm immediately start preparing your order, and serve it efficiently (alongside the dozens of other orders that inevitably load up due to the hype).

The coffee beans are roasted by nearby, popular vendors (i.e. Verve), and results in a high-quality drink for a lower price than had a human prepared it.

Has my vote for an exciting future - I'd expect to see the kiosk scale to many more parts of the city (and around the country) in the near future.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
I tried out Cafe X because I went to their website and they were offering a $5 Promo Code and since I was going to SF anyways decided to stop by after lunch and before SFMOMA.

It's inside the Metreon behind Sharetea on the ground level.  There are 2 iPads that you use to place your order, put in your cell phone number and you'll get a code when your drink is ready.

I got a cappucino for $2.75, it's a small paper cup, not filled all the way to the top.  I picked Verve coffee but it didn't taste very strong to me, more like what you would get at the hospital vending machine.

It said it'll be 3 minutes to make my drink, didn't time it, but it was pretty fast.  Put in your texted code number and the drink is lowered down for you to grab.

I will probably try it again since I still have some money left over.

You can use their app to order your drink, pay, and then pick up quicker.

Hrs: Daily 10:30am-8pm

https://cafexapp.com/
author: Ann L.

description: I was really excited to try this. I ordered, and when my drink was ready my cup was only 1/3 full - it seemed like the machine was out of milk because the next person in line experienced the same thing when ordering a latte. Very disappointing. There was also no way to submit feedback or get a hold of anyone about this which I also thought was strange for an unmanned food service place. Wasted money, wasted time.
author: Kaci L.

description:
I do like how they gave out a few promo codes, but I think paying 4-5 dollars for a coffee size so small is not worth it. I got a Cortado and laid 4 dollars for less than a full cup of coffee which is a total rip off. The second time I got the Matcha latte and it gave me a full cup so that experience was better, the Matcha latte  was also 4 dollars.I would rather hit up Peets that is right across the street, their cup sizes are set at a good price. 

At Cafe X , the  robot is pretty cute , but I miss the ambiance of baristas making your coffee, I feel like with a customer and barista relationship , you can have the freedom to customize your drink better.
author: Esther L.

description: Good coffee drinks. Nice idea. Enjoyed the experience and will return.  We ordered macchiato and cortado, and there are customization options for beans and milk or oatly.
author: Karrot L.

description:
What Cafe X is good for:
-Novelty factor. If you've never had a robot make your coffee before, here's your chance!
-Cheap. Everything on the menu was under $3. And if you visit their website, you can get a code for your first free drink
-Fast. I got my cappuccino in under 1 minute

Thumbs down because:
-To be honest, the cappuccino wasn't very good. It tasted like the cheap coffee you get at the office
-They didn't have a non-dairy milk option yet
-I expected the robot to be able to pour fancy designs into my cappuccino as well as, if not better, than a human would, but alas, there was nothing fancy about my cappuccino

It seems like Cafe X is still kind of in their test phase so I'm down to try Cafe X again when they work out some of their kinks and get a bearing on their true "value-add" in an already crowded coffee/tea/cafe business.
author: Sylvia Y.

description: I really like this place! The drinks are a lot better than I expected. I guess I expected something mediocre because the drinks are made by a machine but I was pleasantly surprised. I especially like the matcha latte. The only thing is that the service is really fast so if you order on your app, the coffee might be poured out by the time you get around to picking it up. That's annoying. But customer service is receptive, helpful, and cooperative. All around, love the coffee and concept. Recommended for sure.
author: Inar C.

description:
Hahahahaha, cute San Francisco experience. I like this robot. He's so sweet. What really got me was that after making your coffee and serving it to you, the robot waves at you. GWAH, my heart just exploded. So sweet. 
It's located in the Metreon. You order by yourself from an iPad. Then you receive a text with a code when it's ready for pickup. Enjoy watching the robot do it's thing. I wish it knew how to do latte art though, haha. That would be OP man. After it's done, you put the code into an iPad in the front area and the robot will serve you your cup and wave its appreciation. 
Also, coffee is decently priced! Of course, there's no coffee connoisseur making you coffee with his or her heart, but for what this robot is - it's pretty neat! 
Four stars because the coffee really does just taste alright though, lol.
author: Kim N.

description:
I love it when I can go to a quirky place and not feel so price gouged that it is no longer fun.  The prices were good.  Coffee was good.  In the same vein the smitten ice cream tastes so incredibly fresh and pure, so is this coffee. We ordered a cappuccino, a cortado, and an Americano all made with Black Cat Analog Espresso.  All were amazing and tasted fresh and pure.  And,a robot that waved goodbye made our coffee.  

Note to parents - this is on the way to the Children's Creativity Museum, Carosel and Yerba Buena play ground
author: Jennifer L.

description:
SF is pretty cutting-edge and techie - and this robotic cafe reflects that vibe. Only in SF (well, the other one is in Hong Kong). Watching the robotic arm make high-quality coffee is a unique spectacle for long-time residents and visitors alike! Be sure to capture the making of your coffee on video! It would be a great memento, whether you're coming from the Tenderloin or Thailand. 

You can choose from several different coffee types - cappuccino and the other usual variations. Definitely check it out! The Metreon has always tried to bill itself as a chic, on-trend, slightly futuristic place - but Cafe X is the most fitting and unique thing to come out of it in a long time. A must-see!  

Oh, and the sidebar on Yelp says they use Intelligentsia, Verve, and other "locally roasted coffee." So you win in every way - bragging rights for getting coffee from a robot, from roasters hipper and newer than Ritual. 

Use the code 3H5ORI for $5 in free coffee! Download the Cafe X app, enter the code, and $5 will be added to your account.
author: Crystal M.

description: Cool gimmick that a robot can make coffee. It's a lil pricey tho. I didn't like the promotions either. I saw a bunch of cards after I got my coffee for a free one and it had a password on it to use. I gave it to my friend to use and it didn't work. Then I noticed all the cards had the same number. What a dagnabbit gimmick!
author: Luke S.

description: Really good local coffee and lightning fast service
author: Rob T.

description: I'd give this 5 stars, but the Metreon location didn't have matcha the two times I attempted. I walked to the Market location and they had matcha! I ordered the matcha latte with oat milk and it was only $3. This would cost $6 elsewhere including tip. The matcha latte was really tasty. I wish there was an option to do no sugar, but for $3, I'm ok with it. It's not overly sweet at all (just trying to be healthier :P) You can a $5 promo through the app with code 707LIY!
author: T D.

description:
#250
This little cafe has been on my Yelp Bucket List, since I saw this place on T.V.  When I arrived at the Metreon it took no time at all to find the cafe. There was one employee there watching over the cafe. A simple menu next to the huge glass case where the robot sits inside. The menu is simple. Theres an IPad there so you can pick what you want to drink. ie: cappuccino, espresso, caffè latte, etcetera. Then you pick how much cream you want and if you want to add any flavors or sugar/fake sugar. Once you confirm your order, you swipe your ATM/Credit card and then robot gets to work. Once your coffee is done, you get a text message with a code to get your coffee. You then walk up to the huge glass case enter your code on one of three other IPads and the robot delivers your coffee to a little elevator shoot. The shoot opens up, and you get a good tasting cup of coffee. There is a little table inside where you can sit and drink your coffee or you can go outside and people watch. 

Be sure to download the Cafe X app and you will recieve $10 of free coffee.
author: Eric S.

description:
This is super cool and easy to use, they feature specialty coffees and give you the option of milk and non-dairy. 

It was a cool experience and the cafe specialists are really helpful.
author: Anthony C.

description: Very cool experience! It's inside a mall. They have two tables and then there's a food court or outside area to sit down.
author: lance e.

description: This was excellent. No line, and very simple to use. The café mocha I had was so rich and delicious. I would come here again. Absolutely no human interaction whatsoever so it's every introvert's dream come true. The little robot hand waves at you after you're done. However, I don't know how you would order without a phone because after ordering, you get a text message with a PIN number that you type in on the iPad where the robot hand will release it to you. Overall it was very cute.
author: Justin T.

description: Get the matacha latte and single origin coffees, which are half the price as other coffee shops -- and with zero wait!
author: jason c.

description:
Specifically had this place on my to-do list during my trip to SF. Love the concept of technology and coffee! Located in the corner of the Metreon, this place was quick and efficient! You can either order from their app or on the touchscreen self-service system.

Once you place your order, the system will tell you if there are any orders before you. Then, watch the magic happen! The robot arm will serve you your own cup of joe. You just input your code and get your drink!

As for the quality of coffee, you really get what you pay for. They currently offer Verve, AKA, and Peet's Coffee. The drink itself was not as great as the ones in actual coffeeshops, but it is efficient and tastes better than regular coffee!

Worth it: Yes!
author: Vicky Y.

description: This is an Intuitive alternative to overpriced specialty coffee shops. And the green tea latte I had was absolutely amazing. It came out ready to drink too, no tongue burning ! Dairy free milk alternatives available too? I have zero complaints. Fantastic.
author: Adam V.

description:
Cafe X is awesome! Some may consider it a "taste" of the future.

Great local coffee choices that are quickly brewed by a robot (the robot even waves at you). I usually use the app, which works smoothly and saves me even more time.

I only wish there were more locations! Can't wait to see more Cafe X's in the future.
author: Ben S.

description: Came for the novelty of having a robot make my coffee...I ordered an Americano with milk and a Really Good Hot Chocolate for my husband. While there is an appeal to futuristic feel and the robot arm does do a cute little wave when it gives you your drink, the coffee was BAD. The Really Good Hot Chocolate does live up to its name. But unless everyone is ordering the Hot Chocolate and/or just doesn't like human interaction, I am boggled by the high rating. Needless to say, but the novelty has worn off and I'd rather stick with the human baristas who know how to make a good cup.
author: Melody R.

description:
What a cool experience. Went with my 12 year old son. Coffee + mom-points for hot chocolate served by a robot = win!
Reasonable price. Good variety. Great service by Borris. Very knowledgeable about the robot and the coffee. Worth another visit.
author: Meeghan P.

description: Extremely HORRIBLE! We put in our phone number and when the coffee was ready, we NEVER received the pick up code! And we just could not pick up that damn $4.50 pricey Americano. And after 5 min, we were still trying to receive the code by downloading the app, the robot arm just THREW our drink away!!! UGH! Complete waste of money!
author: Rachel Shiyun C.

description:
I love the concept of this cafe, it skips the awkward interaction with a cashier. If you're looking for something quick&on the go, this is the place for you. 

I got a Caffe Latte with Vanilla & it was up to my standards, since I don't like my coffee too sweet. This place only makes your standard coffee drinks, don't expect them to make drinks like Starbucks, Peets, etc. (which isn't a bad thing if you don't care for fancy coffee drinks)

My only complaint is I wish there were coffee sleeves available because it's a bit too hot to grab&go. 

If you come across this machine, give it a try! I know some people were hesitant to use this machine but don't be, ordering is simple&straight forward :)
author: Maggie C.

description:
Coffee: solid. It was good coffee, nothing mind blowing. You get to choose your own beans! 

Entertainment: the robot arm only does the serving and setting up, the rest is an automated machine that pumps out espresso and milk. I wish it did more but it was cool to see regardless. 

Service: great! You order from an iPad, get notified when the coffee is ready, and the wait wasn't bad. 

Overall, I would get this coffee again if I'm at the metreon but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Found out about Cafe X via the Hot and New section. I'm not a coffee drinker nor fan but I was intrigued. A robot whippin' up drinks for you? And you don't even have to interact with humans? Say whuh?? I was in...and also because Cafe X was offering up a $5 promo to try them out (check their website).

Located to the left of Sharetea Metreon location I ordered my milk tea from STea and made my way over. You order via an ipad looking podium. They have about 6 or 7 drinks to choose from. All in 8 oz sizes-- most expensive drank $2.95. Flat white? Americano?? Cortado? (they have descriptions) Me not knowing what to order, I just went with the cappuccino because don't it sound fancy? You choose what coffee bean you want and you can add a flavor. Espresso forte and a standard pump of hazelnut for me (you can get 'low', 'standard' or an 'insane' dose of flavaflav). 

After you've completed your drink order. You punch in your #, email and promo code and tap place order. Then the robot goes to work. Once your drink is done, the robot puts it off to the side. You receive a # code via text that your order is ready. Punch in the code into one of the screens outside of the robot's working station then the robot arm places it on a lil' platform and it lowers down for you to grab. Boom done! No need to talk to a barista or deal with any humans! However, there is a human on standby...just in case somebody screws something up...like I did. I had went through the ordering system and I was tryna figure out why my drink wasn't being made. The human asked me if I had forgotten to press 'place order'. Which I did...redid my order and waited for the robot to do it's thing. Grabbed my order and poured it into my canteen bottle and took it home. Blended 2 ice cream sandwiches into it...it was good!

Overall, cool concept, and I guess the drinks are reasonably priced. Can they make a boba X? That'd be awesome. Thanks.
author: Vicky L.

description: Sam from Cafe X reached out to me immediately after seeing the review of my poor initial experience. He offered a refund for my lack-of-coffee the first time and then some credit to give Cafe X another try. I therefore trekked out to the Metreon again to give this robo-cafe a whirl. This time, it was very much worthwhile. I got the matcha latte for myself and a regular latte for my boyfriend. My matcha latte was ::underscore:: delicious, no skimping at all on matcha like some of the other cafes I've gotten this drink from. We also chatted briefly with a nice young fella who was there to make sure the machine was working properly, etc. Overall I'm impressed by the quality of the drinks, and I'm excited to see if Cafe X will have some new seasonal offerings. Side note, it would be fun to see the robot develop a bit more of a "personality",  like flinging a drink once in a while instead of setting it down softly. ;)
author: Isabella S.

description:
I loved my first Cafe X experience, it was rather delightful! 

Ordering from the tablet was easy, and there were plenty of choices for the beans, milk etc. I have to say, the choices were almost endless, and I was NOT expecting this before I tried Cafe X for the first time. This is the real deal, full-service, "all of the choices" coffee shop experience. 

Getting the coffee is a really cool experience, especially when your robotic barista waves to you after they hand you the coffee.. And I like the notion of a perfectly, consistently made cup of cappuccino. My apologies to all of the baristas in SF coffee shops who put their hearts into making me coffee, of which there are many!

And perhaps most importantly - the taste and quality of the drink itself were excellent, top notch. 

The future of coffee is here!
author: Noam S.

description: I was in SFO for few days over thanksgiving and visited Cafe X on friend's recommendation. Robotic Barista is great concept for minimizing long line at Coffee shop with great quality of coffee. I was stunned by the Robotic coffee machine. It was just fantastic. I tried Cafe Mocha and Espresso shot. Both of them were really really good. I would recommend this to any coffee lover. They also have variety of coffee beans options.
author: Harsh S.

description:
The concept is cool...but I prefer artisan lattes. I LIKE the atmosphere of coffee shops, having a fancy design in my drink, and a snooty hipster handing me my beverage. 

The speed, efficiency, novelty, and price are all great, but it tastes like a K-CUP drink. This is San Francisco, not New York. Chillax and get a hand crafted beverage. :P
author: Angela L.

description: Ordered cappuccino with the oat milk, definitely yum. The robert is so cute it waved hands saying bye bye to me after I got my coffee.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I liked it!!
Payment system is so smooth. I don't have to wait in a line and watching the coffee robot was one of my favorite points. Much  better than unfriendly cafes. It's a luxury coffee vending machine.
author: 尚子

description: Awesome coffee! As many varieties of REAL coffee AS Starbucks. Buy one coffee at regular price, download the app and receive $10 worth of free coffee! Buy $100 gift card and you can buy 100 cups of coffee. Best deal ever! No wait. Also got to meet Henry, the founder. He personally attends to the machine. Bye bye Starbucks, Hello Cafe X! More upcoming locations, so keep an eye out for them!
author: Jenny C.

description:
when i was younger (which was a long time ago), coffee used to come from vending machines and this is what Cafe X reminds me of except much fancier. Super easy to order as option are limited. You can order via an app or at the kiosk. It was super quick too. The app shows how long before your coffee starts making. it's fun to watch the robot move but esentially its jut moving the cup to the right coffee section and picking it up. Once done, you get a text on your app and a code to enter in. You walk up to the robot area, pop in your code and the robot hand puts it on the little stand. 

I got the cappucino which was $2.25 and it was pretty good! They also use good coffee beans from Philz and a couple other places. It's fun to watch for sure. Five stars for the limited option and that it tasted good.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I love love this coffee. My experience has been nothing but excellent since the first time i had it. Everytime I come to sf this is the first stop for coffee. The coffee is excellent with a great taste. I did had a lottle trouble at first but there is always somebody on standby. I just wish there were bigger cups.  Overall i highly recommended this place
author: Deisi S.

description:
CafeX is simply the best. I go there every change I get. 

Pro Tip: Download the CafeX app - I can order when I'm a minute away, and pick up my drink with a wait time of less than 1 second (the time it takes me to enter my order #).
author: Rory O.

description: Expensive considering a person did not make it.... Worth a visit. Good selection, fun to see it before your eyes, and it was programmed to even be friendly, ha. Just walk up to the kiosk and enter your details and payment.
author: Liz H.

description:
Oh what an excellent surprise this was!! Right after seeing the "Transformers Last Night" movie at the Metreon I see the Cafe X Robot installation and I just had to try it!! 

Opened menu on electronic kiosk and selected hot chocolate. Was pleased by fact that there was an oatmilk alternative available on the menu as I am a vegan.

Ordered an Oat Milk hot chocolate and watched the robotic arm place a cup under the beverage dispenser then grab the cup again to place it under the flavor dispenser.  Flavor dispenser spinned until the hot chocolate barrel came around then the chocolate was dispensed similar to the pump on a lotion bottle.

Arm places drink on specially designed platform elevator and then waves it's cup hand at you before the elevator descends to the shoot where you pick it up!!

A great technological end to seeing an action packed movie with Transformers in it!!

Also after my first order I was sent an e-mail for a coupon code of up to $10.00 worth of drinks!!

Would give this 10 stars if available!!
author: Djehuti H.

description:
Cafe X is perfect when you are looking for a quick but delicious fix of coffee!

Both Verve beans (Vancouver Swiss Water Decaf and Single Original Muungano) and the Intelligentsia Black Cat Analog Espresso are delicious. Intelligentsia if you like something sweeter, Verve Single Original for something a little more bitter, and Verve Decaf for something in between.

If you aren't feeling coffee at all but want to watch the robot barista make something, you can choose something off the kids menu m.

Cafe X is definitely an experience that makes you feel like you are getting coffee from the future. I am for sure stopping by every time I'm near Metreon.
author: Angus C.

description:
Coffee 2 out of 5
Presentation/Show 4 out of 5

I was instantly drawn towards Cafe X as it was a robot making my coffee for me. I think I somewhat knew what I was walking into being a coffee lover; that the coffee might not be as great but it is a cool experience. However, the reviews on Yelp says otherwise. People were raving about the coffee quality that Cafe X produce, so naturally, I had to try it. 

Unlike other coffee shops in the city, Cafe X is 100% run by the robot, the robot brew and delivers the coffee to you. Different right? Get this, once the coffee is finished brewing, it does not place the coffee in the vending slot but instead sets it aside until the buyer comes and put in their code to whichever vending station (there are two) and then the robot will deliver the coffee to you and even wave goodbye. The robot concept is pretty cool as it is a very quick way to grab coffee and it also helps the mixup that can sometimes happen when coffee shops become really busy. In addition, you have a selection of vendors to choose from (Verve, AKA and other). I enjoyed the variety that was programmed into Cafe X (not just different style of coffee but different vendor). 

Unfortunately, I was not impressed with their coffee quality as others have raved about. I enjoyed the quality of coffee and the different styles it comes in. This quality produced by Cafe X was not of the quality that I had at coffee shops around the city. It produced what I would expect out of an Espresso machine at home or a Keurig. In my personal opinion, the rave on Yelp reviews seem to overhyped it and its definitely a cool experience to check out and I highly recommend it but I wouldn't expect much from the coffee quality. I would give this a 3 out of 5 because the robot brewing your coffee is pretty cool but the coffee is probably a 2 out of 5.
author: Chenny O.

description: This is a unique and amazing experience! You don't have to tell anybody your name, wait in a long line, or make meaningless small talk with the barista while waiting oh so patiently for your beverage. I love how you can place an order when you walk up to the kiosk simply by pressing a few buttons and then swiping your card. Or, if you're in a hurry and you're on your way there, you can order ahead of time using the app on your phone. You get a code to punch in to retrieve your beverage so you know you're not mistakenly grabbing someone else's beverage. (And so someone doesn't snatch yours) You tell the system exactly what you want and how you want it and it does it for you. I wish there was one in the lobby where I work. It's also AMC movie theatre (1000 Van Ness Avenue).
author: Kevin C.

description:
I'm from Australia and we are notoriously spoilt for high quality coffee & world class baristas making excellent an excellent cuppa. 
This awesome robot made me one of the better tasting coffees I had while in the USA - easily as good as the best coffee in Australia.
author: Matt D.

description: Coffee and hot chocolate is really good.  I recommend for everyone to check out this new technology in Metreon.  It's both entertaining watching the robot as a barista and enjoying your order after :-) It deserves the five stars, given the awesome technology, something fun, delicious cup of Joe combo.  You simple want to order more because it's entertaining to watch while waiting for your simple hot chocolate to a variety of espresso and regular coffee selections. Manager is friendly and always ready to answer the puzzles of your mind with this new tech in the city :-) truly only in San Francisco :-)
author: Mac F.

description: Super easy ordering through the app. Cool to watch the robot make the drink. Good coffee. Use my referral code to sign up: 8SE49G
author: Katelyn K.

description:
I recently started drinking Oatly instead of milk and I was delighted to see that Cafe X serves Oatly lattes, matcha, mochas, etc.

Tastes good, it's fast, and it's cheap. Can't ask for more.
author: Kartik S.

description: I ordered a hot chocolate and it was amazing! I stopped by Cafe X on my way to a movie. I'm kind of mad thought because the whole time I was watching the movie I wanted another hot chocolate...lucky for me Cafe X was still open, even though it was midnight. I went back the next day and I was excited to learn there are people who work on site-I downloaded the app which awarded me $10 of free drinks, so now I'm addicted. I'm excited to try every drink on their menu!!
author: Kim W.

description:
This Machine is wild, I was astonished by it. I never thought that the day would come where no humans are needed to make and serve beverages. I think this is a great idea and I am so happy that it is being pushed forward. I hope to see more of these in the upcoming future! I would also like to thank Sam for being so welcoming and answering all the questions I had. I was very confused at first when trying to get a coffee but he assisted me with the machine. I am very glad to have stopped by! 

Ps. Sam is very handsome
author: Jeffry M.

description: I don't drink coffee, but I do drink Hot Chocolate.  CafeX Hot Chocolate was delicious-It's nice the way it is delivered nice and hot, not ready until i say so...Looking forward to getting one of these closer to where I live.
author: Gary F.

description: Easy to use and very interesting. Was very efficient. Loved the robot wave at the end. High quality coffee. Stuck around to have a great chat with Boris (Cafe X) and ask him more questions. Will definitely be back!
author: Matteo D.

description:
A good cup of coffee with a fun display of robotics.

I had a promo code and decided to try a cup on my way to work. Came in early today before the Metreon was even open and found them finishing up tuning the Intelligentsia coffee with one of the roasters. The interface was very simple and my latte was ready quickly. It was cute to watch the robotic arm making the coffee while I waited. By the end I had a latte that was just as good as any I've had in the city.

I'd be curious what's going on in the machine that actually dispenses the coffee and milk. Is the same sort of attention to detail (ground size, water temp and pressure, and milk steaming) going into it as when its made by hand? It'd be cool if some of those mechanics were see through to make the process even more transparent (sorry for the pun). Either way, it was a solid latte for way less than I can get at a regular cafe with a pretty high tech gimmick. I'll certainly be back.
author: Ashley S.

description:
I'll give it five stars for what it is -- a fun and somewhat quirky way to get a decent cup of coffee at the Metreon.  I like the fact that you can choose from different types of beans (at varying prices.)

It's also probably a picture of the future -- when a robotic arm can quickly do the work of a barista, why would anyone want to spend hundreds of dollars per day in wages and benefits?  Like it or not, it's something that is novel now but will be commonplace in the near future.

The coffee is good, the prices are ok, the robot is fun to watch, and it even waves at you.  Use the app to order, or one of the kiosks.  The service is 100% dependable, which is more than you can say for human-staffed places!
author: David T.

description:
Coffee & Technology?! Match made in Silicon Valley heaven.

I came opening day and about 4 times after that and I'm continually convinced this is the future. Of the 5 times I've been here (and 8+ coffees me and my friends have ordered), there was only 1 hitch that was corrected quickly (more on that later).

Taste: You get 3 options of beans, from Peets to one of their premium brands like Verve. I've only tried Verve and AKA, both of which are good, but perhaps not as good as if it were made from a commercial grade La Marzocco espresso machine. I'd say their machine is probably one solid step up from the hum drum fully automatic machines you may see in office buildings, but not as special as one at a premium coffee shop. Taste wise, it's a good compromise between a name brand cafe and Peets/Starbucks, though I still think the milk frothing can be a little bit creamier for cappuccinos and flat whites.

Price: It's about $1 cheaper than going to a nearby premium cafe like Sightglass, which is a good compromise, all things considered.

Convenience: You can order a few minutes ahead! If you miss out on this opportunity, it only takes about a minute to place your order in person and watch the machine do its magic. Super convenient.

What you lose from coming here is latte art, cafe ambience, and some customization or preference that you can tell a human. 

That said, there are always Cafe X staff on hand to talk about the machine and fix any problems. As far as the hitch I mentioned earlier, I tried ordering 2 cups ahead of time, but currently, the app only supports 1 order. When I arrived to pick it up and order a 2nd one for my friend, the robot arm went a little bit off track and kept trying to pick up a cup that was not dispensing. That said, the staff quickly fixed my dual order problem and corrected the robot.
author: Jeff N.

description: I saw coffee and robot and knew I had to visit Cafe X. It's pretty fun to watch the robot arm delicately pick up and place things down. It's also pretty quick. They have a small menu of coffee you can pick from. I think there's only one cup size. I ordered a latte, but didn't really enjoy it.
author: Tabitha H.

description:
Read an article in SF Gate about this start up. 
Happen to be at the Metron and saw their kiosk. 
Fast, efficient and quality is very high. Talked to one of the guys, they are very positive and energetic. I recommend them!
author: Dennis G.

description: Came to San Fran just to visit some different coffee shops. This isn't in a shop, it's actually in a mall type of building, tucked in a corner. We got a cortado (Cuban coffee). It was smooth & tasty!
author: Dawna E.

description:
Great coffee at affordable price. Initially wasn't too sure if it's just a fad and having had similar machine-made coffee I didn't expect much from this experience. 

Turned out the coffee was really good; much better and could be cheaper than the chains. I'd give it five stars if I didn't have to pay an extra $1 for the Verve though. It's just me. I get grumpy if I have to pay more for something I shouldn't!
author: W Y.

description: Best ever mocha! Sweet and delicuous. Get the single origin bean!! So good. Blonde guy who works there is nice too. Highligt of sf. Cant wait to go back!
author: Erika L.

description: Coffee was small for the price, but it tasted fantastic, and the robot was fresh and entertaining. It's fun to record a video of your coffee being made.  Still nothing like a human making your drink, but for the robot experience it was awesome
author: Matt H.

description: I'm giving this a 5 so that ppl come see this. It's such a cool concept and if you're in the area you should swing by and look at what the future could be. Founded by a young student, this is what coming to SF is all about.
author: Dion L.

description:
Very cool concept and marketing, I'll give them that. The coffee itself was mediocre to bad.

It's a mitsubishi electric 6-axis arm pressing a button on a jura-like espresso machine and delivering it to you on a motorized platform. If you want to make the trek and pay 3 bucks to drink nespresso-quality coffee, then sure, it's great. I'll pay the extra 50 cents and tip my barista at a local coffee shop instead. I applaud the concept, but the actual product has a long, long way to go.

Side note : your app shows a human roasting, grinding, and pulling a shot of espresso. Sets the wrong expectations for the actual product.
author: Israel S.

description:
Rave! Rave! Rave! 

Coffee + Robots = wow! 

Came across this cafe of the future in the Metreon. I'm a HUGE Starbucks fan, but I also do love my Sci-fi, so I wanted to check this out. I was pleasantly surprised. The coffee came out great! And with a robot, it would be consistent every single time! The delivery system is great, so you don't have to wait there and wait while your drink is being made, but you can order your coffee in advance and have it "handed" to you once you arrive. I ordered mine via the cafex app. 

Definitely try this place out. You'll do it once for the coolness of it all and you'll be back for the convenience and the pricing. 

We need more! More Cafe Xs on every corner!!
author: Buck T.

description:
It's a fun experience! The coffee comes out really fast too!

I love how you can order on your phone which saves you time and they text you when it is ready.

I been to this location A LOT and I love it! I am always entertained and always tell my co-workers about it really fun will always go back
author: Alyssa C.

description: Quick, convenient, and delicious coffee--that's the main concept of Cafe X. Their beans are from local vendors, and you get to choose from a diverse selection of brands (e.g. Verve, AKA, Peet's, etc.)! The Americano is my go-to drink, and I loved it here. It was neither too bitter nor too mild. Price is reasonable. At first glance, the robot barista is simply a cool, entertaining new coffee machine. However, in the long run (especially with how fast the coffee comes out and how long coffee shop lines can be), Cafe X may be my grab + go coffee spot before work or when I'm in a rush. Just wished they had more locations!
author: Jung Joo K.

description:
I heard of this particular coffee shop online but I never thought I would see it in person so soon. The place is great!! The little robot made my coffee really really fast and it tasted great!! Plus it even waved at me and my friends after it gave us our drinks. All coffee baristas better look out because the future is here and it's only evolving from here!! :D
The only comment i would leave about improving the experience is that I wish you could put multiple options on for flavoring. I got hazelnut but it would've been nice to also put some vanilla and sugar in as well. Sadly the machine only gave me one option to pick so yeah.. more options to put more flavors in please!!
author: Michael B.

description: Super quick service, despite a sizeable crowd of ~20ish people, I got my coffee in under 5 minutes, I'd say even 2 minutes. Coffee wasn't anything mind blowing, but I'm no coffee connaseur. The menu doesn't have any complicated drinks or drip coffee, but the selection is large enough and the experience is novel enough that it beats out the Starbucks (in the same building) if all you need is a quick fix. It should be noted that ordering from here requires a phone and a debit/credit card. Complete the transaction at the emplaced iPads where after paying via card you will enter your phone number to receive a text message with the code to pick up your coffee. Alternatively download the Cafe X app (on iPhone and Android) and do ordering, payment, and receive your pickup code all in one place.
author: James W.

description: We ordered green tea latte and it is actually pretty good.  Kids love the robot, fun experience.
author: Richard L.

description: I've been waiting my entire life for this, and now this is my favorite establishment of all time. ZERO HUMAN INTERACTION! It's impossibly awesome. Please Cafe X branch out into other things. Why tease me with just coffee? I want more. I DEMAND MORE.
author: Lance E.

description:
App-abit confused on applying coupon code for free drinks , however,  UI is pretty user friendly 
Coffee-taste better than chain like Starbucks,  need more specialty drinks perhaps flavored drinks with lavender or rose,  to attract customers
Overall the experience is pleasant and quick, I would love to work with them cuz it sounds so cool.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Very cool piece of tech and great coffee too.

Best part is that I can order on my phone while watch the movie credits upstairs and by the time I get down stairs hot coffee awaits!
author: Geoff H.

description: Pretty good coffee and the robot was kind of fun to Snapchat. It tasted pretty much like the kind you would usually get out of a machine which makes sense because it is a machine. I like it for the convenience factor, no lines because the robot is super efficient at doing its job.
author: Ian S.

description:
This coffee is really good.  The trick (as with ordering coffee any place) is that you have to know what variety and roast you like.  If you just pick it by brand name and not by where the beans are grown or how they are roasted, your results will vary.

There are tons of options, so unless you're a hipster poseur you'll find something you love.

The bonuses are:  there is no waiting, no order screw-ups, and you don't have to talk to anyone!
author: Stan H.

description:
It's so convenient! I order just as I'm about to enter the Metreon, and I stealthily grab my coffee, avoiding any pesky human interactions. Cheaper than a coffee shop Americano, and just as tasty. 

Cafe X tastes like the future.
author: John O.

description:
Isn't it about time where traditionally brewed coffee meets the future (aka robots)?

I was pleased the first time I checked Cafe X out, great price and it was cool seeing the machine does its thing. The best part for me is that you guys serve great quality coffee! I love ordering from my app and it just sends me the confirmation number, and every time I put the numbers in, it's cool to see the automated robot works. Keep it up!! More and more Cafe X corners please!!
author: Annisa J.

description: I like their coffee.  But I mainly wanted to get served by a robot arm.  lol
author: Alex S.

description: I was really skeptical at first about getting my coffee from a machine. I guess I was worried it would mess up or something! But I was so wrong. The coffee at Café X was yummy and the robot and iPad ordering system was really cool too. I got my coffee fast and was able to get to work without having to wait in a long line! I think Café X has got the efficiency part down. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Brianna B.

description:
This robotic machine provides an consistent and excellent coffee. The coffee options are great. 

Use the Cafe X app to order ahead and skip the line.
author: Evan P.

description: Actually I knew this place is from a Chinese Computer News Paper, then googled it, found their introduction on TechCrunch which looks very cool. The next afternoon, I went there with my friend, and we ordered two coffees , even though I'm not a coffee person. But both of us love it. The price is very reasonable. I even met the CEO and Cofound there. I took a pic with him,  he is a nice and very easygoing person. I talked with one of their staff there too, all of them are very friendly and nice.  Very good experience. I would recommend everyone to go there to have a try.
author: Sky L.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed my first experience at Cafe X!! The iPad was really easy to use and they had lots of different options. I got an americano with whole milk (they offer oat milk which I think is awesome) and it was delicious! I like how they use high quality coffee and the robot is so cool to  watch! I was in and out in way under 5 minutes. I definitely recommend checking out Cafe X!
author: Anna S.

description: Getting a drink from this service was an interesting preview of one way we might drink coffee in the future. The interface had a few quirks but was generally well considered and the coffee was good :) A good model!
author: Janardan Y.

description: This little robot is absolutely adorable. He even waves goodbye when you pick up your drink!
author: Garet M.

description: I wasn't sure what to expect from a robot barista, but was imagining more barista (robot arm pouring coffee and frothing milk) and less high end coffee machine (watch a robot arm move a coffee cup around). That said the coffee selection between Verve and Oakland's AKA are great and I enjoyed my coffee well enough to go back in a pinch.
author: Midori G.

description: My double espresso was exceptional and the experience was hilarious to be served by a robot barista. Hope to see one of these kinds of set ups in the Long Beach area in the future.
author: Gretchen A.

description: Great coffee, cool thing to show visitors, worthwhile overall!
author: Akshay C.

description: I got a coffee before heading to the movies. It was so cool! The robot was so awesome! It waves bye when you take your drink. It's a great experience. I highly recommend people to try it.
author: Jacob P.

description: Shoutout to the team that runs this place. I've spent literal hours talking to the people who work at the machine, and they're all really friendly.
author: Liz E.

description: Yelp directed me to Cafe X as a "nearby coffee shop," and I was VERY surprised to discover that the entire store is a quirky robot! 10/10 "novelty factor" + the latte was great!
author: Naomi B.

description: It's super cool to watch the robot make your drink (his name is Gordon), and then the drinks themselves are super delicious. I highly recommend the hot chocolate made with oatly milk, even if you're not dairy-free, trust me. Ordering is really easy via your phone or the iPads by the robot, and there's good promo code deals available if you get their app. Even without promo codes the drinks are very reasonably priced for their taste/quality and the overall cool robot experience. There's also always friendly staff on site to answer questions and dazzle you with their extensive coffee knowledge if you're into that sort of thing. Definitely go here and give it a try if you're in SF.
author: Audrey T.

description:
I was able to come in today and try out one of the espresso's Cafe X had to offer. I think the espresso overall was delivered in a slightly bizarre way - a espresso shot dwarfed by a the normal sized cup it was served in. Seemed a little wasteful and not completely thought out (but must have something to do with the fact that a robot is serving you coffee, not a human).

There have been humans nearby the past few days who are ready to help, although the product seems to be easy enough for anybody who can use an iPhone to operate.

The espresso itself was a solid 2/5 in taste I think, but I'm trying not to base the review off of the taste because I'm no coffee connoisseur. The price however seemed infinitely reasonable, at $2.25 for the espresso, especially in downtown SF. All of the prices seemed really affordable.

Still no non-dairy milk options but I'm looking forward to them adding them in the future.

My final note is less about the current product and more about the potential. I think this product has enormous potential once they iron out some of the kinks. The machine works quickly and the user interface does seem well thought out. I'm excited for them to continue to work on their product, and I hope to be back soon to try out their other vegan product, the Americano.

Edit: I did find it pretty bizarre that somebody contacted Yelp and got them to remove my old review of the location, a one star review. Kind of sad that a company like this can't handle one customer who had a bad experience with them. I even gave them a second shot! Not everything in the world is a five star place, especially when it is first starting out, it is sad to see a company like Cafe X is so concerned about one negative review.

Edit 2: One very exciting thing about this cafe(/technology) is that they can work with the growers to ensure that the cup that they want made can be poured every single time. So, as consistent as Starbucks is, Cafe X could be infinitely more consistent depending on how precise their machine is. Another thing to look forward to from this business.
author: Hans T.

description: This is how coffee will be served in 5 years. There's a cool robot ritual dance that results in a hot cup of espresso based coffee. It's kind of fun but more importantly faster than waiting in line to order at a cafe. I had an americano and the coffee was solid - about what you would get at a 'human' cafe. The only downside is the cup was very hot - apparently robot hands don't mind the heat! They had extra cups to double-cup. I'd like it if they had regular drip coffee too, which I like better than espresso drinks.
author: Josh L.

description: Five stars as a measure of the entire package: This is great coffee served quickly and accurately at a great price with the added fun of watching it get made by a robot. If you're near it, give it a shot. You'll save money and time all while being able to avoid the two coffee places that are owned by one chain on the corner.
author: Shaun P.

description: Cafe X is sensational! A robot takes your coffee order and prepares it right in front of your eyes in minutes! Feels like we're finally living in the future. San Francisco has outdone itself yet again with it's cutting-edge technology and uniquely cool and quirky things. This place has a good selection of coffee beans (and a little kids menu with hot chocolate and stuff if you're not feeling like coffee) that are both fancy and tasty. I am definitely going to be stopping by here to pick up some awesome robot coffee every time I see a movie at the Metreon from now on! Prices are reasonable, robot is super adorable, future is happening, what's not to love?
author: Priyanka P.

description: Very cool spot at the Metreon. Quite user friendly, and makes a great flat white!  You pick the type of coffee, style of drink and any extras and then the equipment takes over.
author: Robert M.

description:
Let me tell you guys a story. So my friends recommended me to come here and try out the robot coffee service, and let me tell you, BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! It was the GREATEST quality cappuccino I've had in such a long time. I have to say, but it was 5x better than Starbucks (not to hate on y'all, love ur frapps). The frothy foam was just perfectly proportional to the amount coffee, and the coffee was rich with flavors. I was surprised when the robot arm waved at me when it served the drink, so totally ADORABLE!! So to sum it all up, this is a totally must have, once you get your first coffee you can't get enough of it. I would strongly recommend this place to all those coffee lover out there. AND if you are reading this right now, go out there to metreon 16 and try the latest "trend" in the coffee industry. 
PS: Try their "REALLY GOOD MILK" at least once, because .... it is REALLY GOOD!
author: Milly D.

description: I really like the coffee here. It is convenient and fast. Coffee is super tasty and reasonably priced. Staffs are very friendly. Robot is fun to watch, especially when he wave after serving your coffee. Love it.
author: Jane H.

description: It is cool seeing a robot arm serving you a coffee but besides that, it is meh. The same thing you can accomplish with a coffee machine. The robot arm is an extra thing.
author: Andres T.

description: Attended a massive conference last week and all the lines for coffee were rediculous. Came across this little gem of a coffeebot and was hooked. I couldn't get enough of these delicious lattes, made just the way I wanted. I wish there was one of these near me. Super entertaining and delicious!
author: Kerri N.

description: Really lovely experience. Meeting with Henry the CEO while my coffee was made was great too, easy to use system to retrieve your coffee, I loved how interactive it was, really wonderful couple of guys who've created this fun experience! I hope they go far!
author: Alayna S.

description: This is how the robots win. Not with a shout but by a whisper that says, "Your mocha latte is ready." Wake up sheeple.
author: Justin S.

description: The coffee wasn't bad, but let's be real - this is all about the experience. It was fun. I hope the team keeps innovating on the concept enough to add things like latte art which would be mind-blowingly cool. The industrial design on this thing is really cool - the moment when the coffee hatch opens, your coffee is illuminated in a ring of glowing light almost like an alien just descended from clouds.
author: Matthew J M.

description: So I discovered robo coffee. Not so much a coffee vending machine but a full on coffee robot that's able to make a pretty decent espresso. If you're in the Bay area totally worth checking out. My only regret is that this isn't in FL.
author: Nicholas R.

description: I was amazed how this cafex robot did its job in preparing my order its a delight to watch him how effective the robot was, really cool.
author: Nelson B.

description: Just bumped into this amazing machine and I just need a cup of coffee. You know what, it's actually way more awesome than most coffee places I've been to! It's fun watching the robot making my coffee so that's a plus. Sam also introduced me to the overall service which made this experience even more knowledgeable. Wish it'd soon be everywhere!!
author: Gary L.

description: Wow! A high tech marvel in the middle of the Metreon, this robotic arm makes coffee like Robocop without any attitude.  Try it out, as it is a fun new experience.  The technology behind the robotic arm is pretty awesome as it has to know how to brew coffee varieties of different origins, but the overall process is fast. The staff behind CafeX is also superfriendly and helpful with questions.  An A+ cup of coffee made by a robot.  Wow!
author: Brent S.

description:
Quick and efficient... Can order from app or iPad.  Very entertaining to watch the robot make the coffee.  Plus, it waives to you after you pick up your coffee.

Taste: ordered a latte, it's standard.  Maybe I choose the wrong creamer, slightly too sweet for me.
author: Winnie Y.

description: Machine coffee at a human price. I mean, you can see the machines, and you hope they're above average. But they're not. Go support your local barista.
author: Seth G.

description: The coffee tastes impressively great and order flow is pretty smooth. Also, the super fast making & delivering processes save waiting time.
author: Zhiyong X.

description: Really great experience! Very fast & entertaining at the same time. Im hooked on the Cortado, it's amazing quality and you can't beat the price!
author: Zach L.

description: Love robots. Love coffee. CafeX mashed the two together AND saved me money and time. The coffee was great quality and got me through a long conference across the street at Moscone West. I hope they make thousands of these!!
author: Ada S.

description: We visited Café X and had our drinks. It was fast and the robot which is making it is so cute, it even waves at you when you leave :) - the coffee taste is very good and price is much less than other places. Highly recommend it. I only recommend to have the drinks a little bit hotter when they are mixed with Milk and have sleeves available. I think it is good idea  for a quick grab and go coffee of your choice.
author: Hasmik G.

description:
I was a little nervous about the coffee quality as I am a bit of a coffee snob. I tried the AKA Coffee beans (latte) and it was surprisingly pretty good.

This should do well in high-traffic locations where convenience is more of a factor. Great experience overall and better than Starbucks (but not as good as artisan, i.e., Blue Bottle, Intelligentsia, Equator). Amazing feat with the robotic arm, but would be even more next level if they could get the milk frothed better (even like Nespresso milk frother).
author: Ron M.

description: The coffee is great and it's fun to watch the machine work. It's pretty amazing how fast, smooth, and precise it is. Perfect espresso pull every time!
author: Lola B.

description: I ordered a latte, chose Peet's beans, and the quality was artisan level. I am picky about coffee--a bad habit I picked up in Oregon--and this espresso hit my bar!
author: jay s.

description: Good, tasty, better quality drink than Starbucks.  Though the cup is smaller than usual, the price is reasonable.  I would come back.   There is a human assistant sitting nearby to offer help to me to navigate the payment process - this is a wise idea since this gadget is new.  I am satisfy and would be more than satisfied if the cup is bigger!
author: J C.

description: Went to check it out because it caught my sons's eye , I purchased a coffee on the tablet and it had my favorite coffee so I choose "Peets" a local Bay Area coffee company super fast robot service and it taste was perfect! Great idea! Will be back!
author: Ruben R.

description: The process is easy, the coffee was good, but the choices are limited. They'll figure it out. Smart people, great concept. I can totally see this on campuses, in train stations, providing coffee 24/7. The Metreon opened at 10:30am on Sunday, which was later than we wanted to start our day, but we were curious about having a robot prepare and serve us. Not sure we'll be back, but it was tasty and quick.
author: Robin A.

description: Awesome and engaging coffee experience! Extremely quick service, and quality of coffee is top notch. Most efficient and cost-effective way to buy coffee in my opinion. Highly recommend to anyone and everyone!
author: Sam P.

description: great lattes, no line and very entertaining to watch, especially for kids!
author: Leyla A.
